page.title: 16Media - The Derby Newspaper
page.content: The{Derby Evening Telegraph}produces a paper from Northcliffe House, Meadow Road. 80,000 papers are produced every night at a rate of 60,000 papers per hour. At Northcliffe House the Tele- graph has its own photograph room, own reporters (news and sports) and its own special editions. The special editions are printed on Bank Holidays when National papers aren't printed. Football Specials are printed on Sat- urday nights and feature Derby County Football Team. On Thursday nights there is a property section showing property being sold in Derby and sur- rounding districts. On Friday nights there is a vehicle section. The paper has a mid-day edition. The 1984/5 cost of the paper is 16p. and it is sold by 480 shops. The paper's first aim is to make money and its second aim is to let people know the latest news.
